info.description: This API is used to manage PM service containers. Containers can be registered based on metadata documents. Containers may also be modifed or removed from the system. The API also provides read/write access to container metadata and container listener configuration. Information on services hosted by a specific container can be retrieved. To add or modify services other APIs can be used.
info.title: Container Management API

get.description: Retreive detailed information on a specific container.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

post.description: Modifies a container to the system using a set of form parameters and metadata file upload as multipart/form-data.

put.description: Modify an existing container using a set of form parameters.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

delete.description: Remove a container from the system.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

get.description:
Returns the PKI configuration (including the encoded certificate chain) used to identify a container. May return no content if no certificate is assigned. See example response for certificate chain encoding.

Request:

GET /rest/containers/uddi:978841b1-7088-11e4-8574-cb4613969888/pki/identity HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json

Response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK

{
  "SubjectDN" : "CN=sa1, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "IssuerDN" : "CN=ca, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "SerialNo" : "4942932839929778611",
  "EffectiveDate" : "2017-01-11-08:00",
  "ExpirationDate" : "2018-01-11-08:00",
  "EncodedCertChain" : "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Primary Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n \
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Root Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n"
}

post.description: Modify a container's certificate using multipart-form-data.

parameters.name: parameter0
parameters.description: The certificate in .CER or .DER file format.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

get.description: Get all listeners configured for a container.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

post.description: Add a listener to a container.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

post.description: Modify a container's metadata using multipart-form-data.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

get.description: Get a list of containers in a cluster.

404.description: Specified container or cluster not found (Invalid key)

post.summary: Add a Container to a Cluster (Form-Based)
post.description: Add a container to a cluster.

404.description: Specified container or cluster not found (Invalid key)
Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

post.summary: Add a Container to a Cluster
post.description: Add a container to a cluster.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: The container key. Deprecated. Please use the POST body instead.

parameters.name: parameter0
parameters.description: List of containers to add along with the instruction to replace all nodes or just add to. Optional. Can also use the container query parameter for backwards compatibility.

404.description: Specified container or cluster not found (Invalid key)

post.description: Add a container to the system using a set of form parameters.

parameters.name: OrganizationKey
parameters.description: The organization that should contain the new container.

parameters.name: ClusterKey
parameters.description: An optional cluster key if the container should be added to a cluster.

parameters.name: MetadataLocation
parameters.description: The location of the container's metadata document.  Either this or the metadata parameter must be provided.

parameters.name: MetadataUsername
parameters.description: Username to use to access the container's metadata document if authentication required. Used with the metadataLocation parameter.

parameters.name: MetadataPassword
parameters.description: Password to use to access the container's metadata document if authentication required. Used with the metadataLocation parameter.

parameters.name: Metadata
parameters.description: The new container's metdata as an XML form-encoded document if a location is not provided.

parameters.name: CreateCluster
parameters.description: Indicates that the cluster should be created. Optional, default value is false.

parameters.name: ClusterName
parameters.description: Name of clsuter to create. Used with the CreateCluster parameter.

parameters.name: ClusterDescription
parameters.description: Description of clsuter to create. Used with the CreateCluster parameter.

get.description: Fethc all services hosted in a specified container.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

get.description: Fetch details for a specific container listener.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key) or invalid listener name

put.description: Modify the configuration of a container listener.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key) or invalid listener name
Specified container not found (Invalid container key) or invalid listener name
Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

post.description: Modify a container's metadata using a set of form parameters.

parameters.name: MetadataLocation
parameters.description: The container metadata location.  Either this or the metadata string must be provided.

parameters.name: MetadataUsername
parameters.description: Username to use to access the container's metadata document if authentication required. Used with the metadataLocation parameter.

parameters.name: MetadataPassword
parameters.description: Password to use to access the container's metadata document if authentication required. Used with the metadataLocation parameter.

parameters.name: Metadata
parameters.description: The container metadata as an encoded XML string.

404.description: Specified container not found (Invalid container key)
Specified container not found (Invalid container key)

get.summary: Returns the listener PKI configuration (if any).

post.summary: Add PKI keys and certificate for a listener.

parameters.name: forceTrust
parameters.description: Add to trust store if not trusted already

get.description:
Returns the outbound PKI configuration including the encoded certificate chain for a container (if it exists). May return no content if no certificate is assigned. See example response for certificate chain encoding.

Request:

GET /rest/containers/uddi:978841b1-7088-11e4-8574-cb4613969888/pki/outbound HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json

Response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK

{
  "SubjectDN" : "CN=sa1, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "IssuerDN" : "CN=ca, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "SerialNo" : "4942932839929778611",
  "EffectiveDate" : "2017-01-11-08:00",
  "ExpirationDate" : "2018-01-11-08:00",
  "EncodedCertChain" : "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Primary Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n \
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Root Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n"
}

post.summary: Uploads outbound PKI keys and certificate for a container.
post.description:
Uploads a keystore that holds outbound PKI key/cert data for a container. The following is an example request and response.

Request:
POST /rest/uddi:978841b1-7088-11e4-8574-cb4613969888/pki?alias=https1&keystorePass=changeit&aliasPass=changeit HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=Jlo6Rm_FfX2_s3WQ5QhfUoY6qqLxTbdyHMSkf0W
--Jlo6Rm_FfX2_s3WQ5QhfUoY6qqLxTbdyHMSkf0W
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileUpload"; filename="test.jks"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
<File content omitted>

Response:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created if creation successful

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: Alias in the keystore to use.

parameters.name: aliasPass
parameters.description: Alias password. Can be omitted if not needed or the same as the keystore password.

parameters.name: forceTrust
parameters.description: Add to trust store if not trusted already. If false and not trusted an error will be returned. Can be omitted. Default is false.

delete.summary: Remove a Container from a Cluster
delete.description: Remove a container from a cluster.

404.description: Specified container or cluster not found (Invalid key)

get.description:
Returns the PKI configuration (including the encoded certificate chain) for a listener. May return no content if no certificate is assigned or applicable based on type of listener. See example response for certificate chain encoding.

Request:

GET /rest/containers/uddi:978841b1-7088-11e4-8574-cb4613969888/listeners/https1/pki HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json

Response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK

{
  "SubjectDN" : "CN=listener1, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "IssuerDN" : "CN=ca, OU=Akana, O=Akana, ST=CA, C=US",
  "SerialNo" : "4942932839929778611",
  "EffectiveDate" : "2017-01-11-08:00",
  "ExpirationDate" : "2018-01-11-08:00",
  "EncodedCertChain" : "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Primary Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n \
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n... Root Certificate bytes ...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n"
}

post.summary: Uploads PKI keys and certificate for a listener.
post.description:
Uploads a keystore that holds PKI key/cert data for a listener. The following is an example request and response.

Request:
POST /rest/uddi:978841b1-7088-11e4-8574-cb4613969888/listeners/https1?alias=https1&keystorePass=changeit&aliasPass=changeit HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=Jlo6Rm_FfX2_s3WQ5QhfUoY6qqLxTbdyHMSkf0W
--Jlo6Rm_FfX2_s3WQ5QhfUoY6qqLxTbdyHMSkf0W
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileUpload"; filename="test.jks"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
<File content omitted>

Response:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created if creation successful
{
"Endpoint" : <Endpoint structure for listener>
}

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: Alias in the keystore to use.

parameters.name: aliasPass
parameters.description: Alias password. Can be omitted if not needed or the same as the keystore password.

parameters.name: forceTrust
parameters.description: Add to trust store if not trusted already. If false and not trusted an error will be returned. Can be omitted. Default is false.

post.description: Add a container to the system using a set of form parameters and metadata file upload as multipart/form-data.
